alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Beaver; Butler; Washington (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 18 at 12:53PM EST until November 18 at 1:15PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EST FOR CENTRAL BEAVER...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER AND NORTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY COUNTIES... At 1252 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Mars to Economy to 8 miles northeast of Avella, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 19 and 39. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 62 and 92. Parkway North between mile markers 8 and 13. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 37 and 62. Locations impacted include... Ross Township, McCandless Township, Cranberry, Moon Township, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Monaca, Avella, Hampton Township, Robinson Township, Cecil-Bishop, and Economy. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
